page.title: 05SURF LIFE SAVING
page.content: When someone is drowning at sea a team of six people conduct the rescue in the following way: The rescuer puts on a harness which is attached to a strong line on a reel, which the linesman operates. The four other members pay out line over their heads as the rescuer swims out to the person in difficulties. When he reaches the patient, he will signal to the team. They will pull them both in until they reach the shore. After placing the patient on the beach, the linesman will try to resuscitate him. When he starts breathing, he is put in the recovery position. The whole team stays with him until he recovers or until qualified medical help arrives. The equipment is put away carefully so that it may be used quicly the next time there is an emergency.
